solution.text:
To find the value of the expression \(2\times \alpha + \beta\) we have to find the zeros of the quadratic equation
factorizing the equation we get
\(_{{j*j}}_x^2 - _{{j*k}}_x - _{{j*k}}_x + k^2\)
\(_{j}_x(_{j}_x-_{k}_) - _{k}_(_{j}_x-_{k}_)\)
\(\Rightarrow (_{j}_x-_{k}_)(_{j}_x-_{k}_)=(_{j}_x-_{k}_)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow \alpha=\frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}\, and \,\beta=\frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}\)
Hence the value of \(2\times \alpha + \beta = 2\times \frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_} + \frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow 3\times \frac {_{k}_}{_{j}_}\)

content.text:
If \(\alpha \) and \(\beta \) are the zeros of the given polynomial \(f(x)=_{{j*j}}_x^2-_{{2*j*k}}_x+_{{k*k}}_\)
Find the value of the expression \((2\times \alpha) + \beta\)
